Preparing for publishing with GitHub Pages

At the end of discussing how to produce HTML documents from .Rmd the official page of the rmarkdown package mentions that entire website can be produced using R Markdown and the described methodology.

To create a website like rmarkdown.rstudio.com can be accomplished using a combination of GitHub Pages and Jekyll (static website generator). The current guide narrates the process of preparations needed to publish a statitic website on GitHub.

GitHub Pages Help

To organize the process of learning new concepts and terminology the reader is directed to GitHub Pages Help. I will be moving through this reference articles in order, installing the components as needed.

User & Organization

  • User - person
  • Organization - lab
  • Project - publication

Creating Pages with the automatic generator

impressions so far: - limiting: - has to go throw creating every time - can’t figure out how add pages to gh-pages branch - clunky

Installing Jekyll

  1. Ruby A. Installation
    • Installing Ruby for Windows using RubyInstaller
    • version: Ruby 1.9.3-p545
    • installation directory: C:193
    • check Add Ruby executables to your PATH box, I checked all B. Developmental Kit
    • tdm-32-4.5.2
  2. Bundler
  • Open there local GitHub folder
  • Initiate command line by typing cmd in the address bar of the File Explorer
  • type in gem install bundler in the command line
    • the text should say that the 1 gem has been installed
  1. Jekyll
  • created a text file Gemfile.txt in the root of the repository

  • the content of the file is

    source 'https://rubygems.org'
gem 'github-pages'

  • renamed Gemfile.txt into Gemfile

Setting up “Tutorials” website

The following will state the account of how tutorials website was created.

Get to the gh-pages branch of the rmarkdown(https://github.com/rstudio/rmarkdown/tree/gh-pages) GitHub repository. Into the root of your project’s gh-pages branch copy the following: - folder libs containing style libraries - folder include containing header and footer for the website - file Makefile - clarify the function - file _output.yaml - defining the common output options for .Rmd files
